key_points: Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner face challenges being accepted into Indian Creek Country Club.
They purchased a residence in Miami's 'Billionaire’s Bunker' in December.
Admission to the country club requires nomination and a formal application, which can be stopped by a single objection.
Members of the country club have already voiced objections, particularly after January 6 Capitol events.
Despite country club difficulties, the couple has been welcomed by the Billionaire’s Bunker community.
They have received numerous dinner invitations from the largely Republican enclave.
Jared's brother Josh and Karlie Kloss purchased a nearby mansion, enhancing their social circle.
Both couples' homes are close to Mar-a-Lago, where Donald and Melania Trump may spend their post-presidential life.
Ivanka Trump reportedly harbors ambitions of running for president.
Indian Creek Country Club has faced controversies over its membership policies in the past.
